00144 /* The following macros are used to pretty similarly to regular fatal and assert
00145    calls, with the exception that when *not* in DEBUG mode, the failure does not
00146    immediately terminate the program.  Instead, the retval argument is immediately
00147    returned by the enclosing function, and the oracle's hosed bit is set.  Upon
00148    detecting that it is hosed, the oracle will attempt to flush the pipeline and
00149    then restore the state of the processor.  This allows you to still get results
00150    even when you haven't debugged every last corner case.  Make sure you check the
00151    number of emergency recoveries in the simulator's output stats; if this number is
00152    small relative to the number of total simulated cycles, then your bug probably
00153    won't have much statistically significant impact on your results.  If it's a
00154    large number, then go fix your bug(s)! */
00155 #ifdef DEBUG
00156 #define zesto_fatal(msg, retval) fatal(msg)
00157 #else
00158 #define zesto_fatal(msg, retval) { \
00159   core->oracle->hosed = TRUE; \
00160   fprintf(stderr,"fatal (%s,%d:thread %d): ",__FILE__,__LINE__,core->current_thread->id); \
00161   fprintf(stderr,"%s\n",msg); \
00162   return (retval); \
00163 }
00164 #endif
00165 
00166 #ifdef DEBUG
00167 #define zesto_assert(cond, retval) assert(cond)
00168 #else
00169 #define zesto_assert(cond, retval) { \
00170   if(!(cond)) { \
00171     core->oracle->hosed = TRUE; \
00172     fprintf(stderr,"assertion failed (%s,%d:thread %d): ",__FILE__,__LINE__,core->current_thread->id); \
00173     fprintf(stderr,"%s\n",#cond); \
00174     return (retval); \
00175   } \
00176 }
00177 #endif
00178 
00179 class core_oracle_t {
00180 
00181   /* struct for tracking all in-flight writers of registers */
00182   struct map_node_t {
00183     struct uop_t * uop;
00184     struct map_node_t * prev;
00185     struct map_node_t * next;
00186   };
00187 
00188   /* structs for tracking pre-commit memory writes */
00189 #define MEM_HASH_SIZE 32768
00190 #define MEM_HASH_MASK (MEM_HASH_SIZE-1)
00191 
00192   struct spec_mem_t {
00193     struct {
00194       struct spec_byte_t * head;
00195       struct spec_byte_t * tail;
00196     } hash[MEM_HASH_SIZE];
00197   };
00198 
00199   /* structure used for tracking memory requests made by system calls */
00200   struct syscall_mem_req_t {
00201     int thread_id;
00202     md_addr_t addr;
00203     enum cache_command cmd;
00204     struct syscall_mem_req_t * next;
00205   };
00206 
00207   public:
00208 
00209   bool spec_mode;  /* are we currently on a wrong-path? */
00210 
00211   bool hosed; /* set to TRUE when something in the architected state (core->arch_state) has been seriously
00212                 corrupted. */
00213 
00214   bool trap_on; /* this is set when the TRAP instruction is encountered and reset when IRET is encountered*/
00215   core_oracle_t(struct core_t * const core);
00216   void reg_stats(struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb);
00217   void update_occupancy(void);
00218 
00219   struct Mop_t * get_Mop(const int index);
00220   int get_index(const struct Mop_t * const Mop);
00221   int next_index(const int index);
00222 
00223   bool spec_read_byte(const md_addr_t addr, byte_t * const valp);
00224   struct spec_byte_t * spec_write_byte(const md_addr_t addr, const byte_t val);
00225 
00226   struct Mop_t * exec(const md_addr_t requested_PC);
00227   void consume(const struct Mop_t * const Mop);
00228   void commit_uop(struct uop_t * const uop);
00229   void commit(const struct Mop_t * const commit_Mop);
00230 
00231   void recover(const struct Mop_t * const Mop); /* recovers oracle state */
00232   void pipe_recover(struct Mop_t * const Mop, const md_addr_t New_PC); /* unrolls pipeline state */
00233   void pipe_flush(struct Mop_t * const Mop);
00234 
00235   void complete_flush(void);
00236   void reset_execution(void);
00237 
00238   static enum md_fault_type syscall_mem_access(int thread_id, struct mem_t *mem, enum mem_cmd cmd,
00239                                                md_addr_t addr, void *vp, int nbytes);
00240 
00241 
00242   
00243   protected:
00244 
00245   /* static members shared by all cores */
00246 
00247   static bool static_members_initialized;
00248 
00249   struct Mop_t * MopQ;
00250   int MopQ_head;
00251   int MopQ_tail;
00252   int MopQ_num;
00253   int MopQ_size;
00254   struct Mop_t * current_Mop; /* pointer to track a Mop that has been executed but not consumed (i.e. due to fetch stall) */
00255 
00256   static struct map_node_t * map_free_pool;  /* for decode.dep_map */
00257   static int map_free_pool_debt;
00258   static struct spec_byte_t * spec_mem_free_pool; /* for oracle spec-memory map */
00259   static int spec_mem_pool_debt;
00260   struct syscall_mem_req_t * mem_req_free_pool; /* for syscall memory requests */
00261 
00262   struct core_t * core;
00263   struct spec_mem_t spec_mem_map;
00264   /* dependency tracking used by oracle */
00265   struct {
00266     struct map_node_t * head[MD_TOTAL_REGS];
00267     struct map_node_t * tail[MD_TOTAL_REGS];
00268   } dep_map;
00269 
00270   struct syscall_mem_req_t * syscall_mem_req_head;
00271   struct syscall_mem_req_t * syscall_mem_req_tail;
00272   int syscall_mem_reqs; /* total number of syscall memory requests */
00273   int syscall_remaining_delay;
00274 
00275   void undo(struct Mop_t * const Mop);
00276 
00277   void install_mapping(struct uop_t * const uop);
00278   void commit_mapping(const struct uop_t * const uop);
00279   void undo_mapping(const struct uop_t * const uop);
00280   struct map_node_t * get_map_node(void);
00281   void return_map_node(struct map_node_t * const p);
00282 
00283   void install_dependencies(struct uop_t * const uop);
00284   void commit_dependencies(struct uop_t * const uop);

00288   void return_spec_mem_node(struct spec_byte_t * const p);
00289 
00290   void commit_write_byte(struct spec_byte_t * const p);
00291   void squash_write_byte(struct spec_byte_t * const p);
00292 
00293   void cleanup_aborted_mop(struct Mop_t * const Mop);
00294 
00295   static const seq_t DUMMY_SYSCALL_ACTION_ID = ULL(0x2E570515CA111D);
00296   static const unsigned DUMMY_SYSCALL_OP = 0x515CA11;
00297   static void syscall_callback(void * const op);
00298   static bool syscall_translated_callback(void * const op,const seq_t);
00299   static seq_t syscall_get_action_id(void * const op);
00300 };

00302 /* fetch an instruction */
